title: 108_hr5203
content: The Act titled "Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2004" provides crop disaster assistance. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like "additional coverage," "insurable commodity," and "noninsurable commodity" related to crop insurance. Emergency financial assistance is also mentioned, overriding a specific section of the Federal Crop Insurance Act. The Secretary of Agriculture can use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred crop losses in 2003 or 2004 due to damaging weather. The assistance will be administered similarly to a previous Act, with the same loss thresholds for quantity and quality losses. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers for crop losses in 2003 or 2004 due to damaging weather. Assistance will be reduced if producers receive assistance from another crop loss program. Producers must have insurance for insurable crops to be eligible for assistance. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers for crop losses in 2003 or 2004 due to damaging weather. Assistance will be reduced if producers receive assistance from another crop loss program. Producers must have insurance for insurable crops to be eligible for assistance. The Secretary may waive requirements for noninsurable commodities if producers enter into a contract agreeing to specific conditions. Producers must submit required paperwork and pay administrative fee by State filing deadline for noninsurable commodities for the next 2 crops under the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996. Violation of contract will result in producer reimbursing Secretary for assistance provided. SEC. 3. LIVESTOCK ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide livestock loss payments to producers for either 2003 or 2004 losses in counties with emergency designations. A portion of the funds will be allocated for the American Indian livestock program. Assistance will be administered similarly to the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001. In the Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001, the Secretary will not penalize producers who take actions to reduce livestock numbers during disaster conditions when determining eligibility for livestock assistance payments. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to assist producers who suffered tree losses during the winter of 2003 through 2004. This assistance program is established under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002. Additionally, the Secretary will utilize the Commodity Credit Corporation's funds, facilities, and authorities to implement this Act. Regulations will also be put in place. The Secretary may issue necessary regulations to implement the Act without following certain procedural requirements. Additionally, the Secretary will utilize the Commodity Credit Corporation's funds to assist producers affected by tree losses. Amounts appropriated in this Act are designated as emergency requirements, subject to an official budget request from the President to Congress.
